programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: After discovering the remains of a Marine captain, the NCIS team travels to Texas to interrogate the suspected killer.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Parker and Knight discover three bodies on an old Navy ship that's about to be sunk and turned into an artificial reef, when they're suddenly locked inside by a mysterious figure; Vance offers Knight a unique opportunity.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The Coast Guard Investigative Service works with the NCIS team when an explosion occurs on an oil rig; a mysterious prankster targets the team.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When family matters force Gibbs to leave mid-case, McGee and Tony argue over who should lead the murder investigation in his place.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is forced to take another look at a hit-and-run murder case; McGee becomes suspicious of Tony's unusual behavior.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: What looks like a routine SWAT takedown of a terrorism suspect turns into a potentially deadly ambush of our people.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: A waitress may be involved in a piracy scheme and may be connected to some drug dealers; meanwhile Myles is being considered for a new position.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Bobby is in for an emotional upheaval when his wayward father comes back into his life with a very surprising proposition.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue's special skill of lipreading lands her on an FBI/DEA task force - but when an unexpected turn of events occurs, she finds her credibility - and her job - on the line.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull attempts to assist his ex-wife's defense in a wrongful death lawsuit, but he's hindered by unresolved conflicts from their marriage and a longstanding rift with her brother.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull faces his past when he returns to his childhood home to help with the defense of a young man accused of arson.

programme.title: Bull

programme.title: Bull

programme.desc: The team members search for a vengeful suspect who was once abused; Garcia travels to Texas to confront the person she shot.

programme.title: Criminal Minds

programme.title: Criminal Minds

programme.desc: The team believes a suspect is taking on the persona of an Internet urban legend when people with substantial social media followings are found dead; Savannah and Morgan try to find time for each other.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As the team investigates the disappearance of a prominent Boston attorney, secrets of the man's past are revealed.

programme.title: FBI

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: A serial bomber appears to be targeting Wall Street's elite; Maggie and OA search for a suspect who seems set on revenge; Dana deals with Spencer Briggs, a cocky profiler brought in to consult on the case.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The daughter of a wealthy family is kidnapped in an attempt to gain notorious internet fame; Maggie and OA discover the kidnapper's plans go far beyond abduction.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: OA and Maggie team up with members of the FBI's Fugitives Department to track down a person wanted for murder who is also on America's Top 10 Most Wanted list.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team must take down a dangerous drug ring after an American diplomat is killed while being used as a pawn; Jubal and OA try to help friends from their past fight off their inner demons.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a controversial senior leader from Egypt comes to New York for a heart transplant, OA struggles to balance his personal opinion with his professional duty when he is assigned to the security detail.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is a big fan and old friend of Buzz MacClaine, a popular mystery writer, and the author asks the private eye to help edit his latest work. When Buzz meets his own violent end, Mike Hammer takes on the case to find the killer. But in this case, life seems to imitate art. Hammer and his team realize that his manuscript is filled with clues to an actual crime, and they must decode the mystery novel in order to find Buzz's killer.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: There's more than just paint on the walls when Mike tries to help Velda after her boyfriend, an artist, is murdered in his studio before an exhibition. But Hammer struggles to connect the dots in this mysterious case, and a long list of suspects emerges when he discovers that the artist often made others see red. Could it be the artist's jealous ex, the wealthy art collector, the corrupted art critic, the gallery owner, or even Velda herself?

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Hammer's on-again off-again flame is a Broadway star named Linda Fortunato, but her latest role is as primary suspect in the murder investigation of her ex-husband and co-star. The whole city is convinced of her guilt after the spatting couple was seen fighting during rehearsals, but Mike Hammer is determined to clear her name. Drama and mystery unfold while Hammer investigates a whole cast of suspects.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: After being released from his time in prison, Mike Hammer's old friend Herman Simpson joins him for dinner. The discussion turns techie when Simpson brings up the computer revolution that is underway. However, a bank robbery involving this same technology-- and a suspiciously similar criminal --takes place the same evening. Simpson becomes the prime suspect, and Hammer is his only hope at staying free.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A federal agent's murder is linked to an ancient system of money transfer; Granger and Kensi work with the team from Afghanistan.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of two private military contractors ends up putting a member of the team in grave danger; Sam arranges a blind date for Callen.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam search for a murder suspect -- a retired assassin (Danny Trejo) they encountered on their first case together.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team and an undercover DEA agent must determine if an explosion at a fish market was an act of terror or a smuggling deal gone wrong; a helicopter crash may be tied to Kensi and Granger's search for the white ghost.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When a gang identifies and executes an undercover agent, the team must locate a mole before other agents are put in danger.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Despite all of our modern technology and sophistication, there is much that we still don't know about what lies beneath our feet, deep underground.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: From ancient civilizations to 20th century empires, mankind has had an inexplicable fascination with preserving the dead. But why?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: What motivates someone to steal? Is it just for the money, or could a criminal have other reasons for pulling off a particularly daring robbery?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: What gives animals extraordinary powers? We like to think of ourselves as the peak of evolution--but what if we're wrong?

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: There's a growing phenomenon of alleged UFO sightings known as Orbs. Witnesses who see the Orbs also report having dreams, premonitions, and a deep fear.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: They are described by hundreds of witnesses as grey-skinned beings: no ears, no nose and bulbous black eyes. Are these so called "Greys" visitors from another planet? The team investigates stories of abductions in two different countries.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: It has long been suspected that Nazi leaders had more than a passing interesting in the occult and UFOs. UFO investigators now believe there was a connection between the UFO phenomenon and the Third Reich.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Area 51 is considered the ultimate top secret facility, one that UFO investigators believe houses an extraterrestrial secret. But is there an even more secretive facility? In Dugway, UT, there is a remote testing facility sometimes referred to as Area 52.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: From microscopic particles, to large pieces of unknown metal--UFO "trace cases" offer some of the most convincing evidence that UFOs may have been visiting earth for centuries.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On October 26, 1994, the U.S. government made their first official acknowledgement of Area 51. Six months later, nearly 4,000 acres of previously public land surrounding the base were closed.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On April 19, 1897, the Dallas Morning News reported a mysterious airship had crashed into a windmill in the nearby town of Aurora, Texas. Townspeople were said to have found an alien body and buried it in the local graveyard.

programme.title: Vanished in Paradise: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Hannah Upp, a 32-year-old teacher, vanishes in the U.S. Virgin Islands in 2017 in the chaotic days between two major hurricanes; her family and friends believe that she may be lost and wandering in a "fugue state," a rare form of temporary amnesia.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When 19-year-old aspiring artist Sarah Stern goes missing just weeks before Christmas 2016, investigators initially suspect she may have committed suicide or run away from home.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: On October 20, 2014, white Chicago PD Officer Jason Van Dyke fatally shoots 17-year-old African American Laquan McDonald in an act that he and the Chicago PD called self-defense.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Model and mother Samira Frasch loves the spotlight, but when her glamorous life ends unexpectedly in her pool, investigators turn their eyes toward the web of heated relationships surrounding her family.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Beloved 60-year-old chiropractor Mary Yoder falls violently ill and is rushed to the hospital; two days later, she dies, leaving her family and friends in a state of stunned disbelief; Mary's autopsy report reveals she didn't die of natural causes.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: In February 2014, Houston police receive a tip from a conscientious bail bondsman that a murder-for-hire plot is in the works and a woman's life may be in danger.

Smith, Harry Reasoner, Barbara Walters, Peter Jennings, Charles Gibson, Bob Woodruff, Elizabeth Vargas and -- most recently -- Diane Sawyer.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: A fan of "Training Day" wants his '78 Monte Carlo built in the same vein.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty's right-hand man Joe wants to create a widebody Accord for his wife.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty and team build a 1956 Corvette that will be auctioned for charity.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: The '56 Corvette is completed, but in arctic blue instead of red.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: A Ford collector convinces Shorty to take on his '71 Torino GT.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: A good customer brings a troubled 1965 Ford Mustang into the shop; Noah and the crew attempt to restore life to a 1965 Cobra that is not running.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah challenges his crew to improve on two amazing cars.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah has his hands full with a couple carrying two separate visions.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah's excited to stretch his wings on a Triumph TR3.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah challenges his team to turn a 1969 Chevelle into a fierce speed demon.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah and his team work on a 1962 Corvette.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: A rust bucket 1953 Ford F-100 on its last legs gets an epic overhaul.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah turns his lead fabricator, Scott, loose on a 1962 Chrysler 300.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The team tries to outdo themselves with a redesign of 1950 Ford F5 COE.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The client asks for a last-minute engine swap on the '50 Ford F5 COE build.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Bill and the team fix another shop's botched lift on a 2017 Ford F-350.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A '65 Ford Falcon Club Wagon is transformed into a custom family cruiser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A 1973 El Camino is transformed into the Ride of the Future.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: After a long pause, the team gets their chance to finish a 1968 Chevy C10.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1937 International Harvester gets a big old Cummins 12-valve diesel engine that's as heavy as the truck itself; a 2005 Chevy Colorado gets a new lease on life as a nitrous-infused drag truck.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: HOF running back Earl Campbell arrives with the parts of a 1949 Cadillac,

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: NFL Hall-of-Famer Earl Campbell made a career mowing down defenders, so the guys take the same hell-bent approach to rebuilding his 1949 Cadillac; they also customize a van for a disabled motocross rider so he can drive again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A long-time client wants to improve upon a near-perfect '68 Ford Ranger; the team is up to the task with an all-new custom chassis, handmade interior, rebuilt bed and Coyote 5.0 engine swap; the guys check off new custom upgrades on a '75 Bronco.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 Impala throws the guys for a loop when they discover it's an imposter; the team makes it better than ever, with custom body fabrications, rear subframe and handmade interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and his team make one of their longest custom chassis ever for a new 2020 Denali, and Ekstensive gets a diesel pro-mod drag car back on the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a 1979 Little Red Express and a Suzuki Samurai lake crosser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a Samurai rock crawler and a Gladiator with a Hellcat.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Mod Mafia transforms a fire-damaged M1038 Humvee ambulance into an extreme camping overlander; the Wide Open Garage team builds a bulletproof race car for the appropriately billed Death Car Race, in which drivers are blindfolded.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A request about a 1947 Ford truck becomes 1 Way Diesel Performance's next ground-up build; Mod Mafia jumps into uncharted territory with a Viper ACRX race car.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Looking into what happens if a Cummins diesel engine is put into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo; a customer wants Wide Open Garage to turn an old, rusted Chevy truck into a lifted, all-terrain truck on huge 74-inch tires.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Putting a twin-turbo Cummins into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo is a monster build unlike any other for 1 Way Diesel Performance. YouTube's "Unspeakable" star Nathan Graham asks Mod Mafia to help him out of a jam with his all-terrain, amphibious SHERP.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The 1991 Land Rover Defender is known for ruggedness and simplicity; Mod Mafia does a reboot of a tired, old Defender with modern performance, power and custom luxury; Wide Open Garage takes an old-school Bronco monster truck into overdrive.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Social media star Liver King not only wants Mod Mafia to beef up his prized 2001 H1 Hummer's performance, he wants to customize it for his primal lifestyle; the team at Wide Open Garage must build a custom off-road truck completely from scratch.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Wide Open Garage's mega-truck build gets even bigger as they take an old-school '82 C10 square body and create a one-of-one show truck, monster truck; one Way Diesel Performance lives up to their name by giving an '88 Silverado more than 1,200 horsepower.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: 1 Way Diesel Performance is thrown a mega-curveball with a classic '48 Dodge Power Wagon. In a race pitting garage vs. garage, a 2,700hp diesel truck hits the line against a turbocharged first-generation Camaro.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Erik Estrada wants to transform his wood-paneled ’83 Rolls-Royce limo.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Team Unique takes on a major project for Nick Cannon's 1967 Chevelle.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Geraldo Rivera brings his 2004 Tacoma to Team Unique.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: The team flips a Range Rover makeover for rapper Fat Joe.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: DJ Khaled asks Will to take a Wrangler and make it the most unique ride.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Team Unique transforms Mike Epps' Camaro into a custom dream ride.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team gets a wrecked 2008 Suzuki Hayabusa back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team gets a 1971 Chevelle ready to go back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Jessi and Bogi start to work on the 1969 Camaro Z28 they recommended.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team turns a Rubicon into a Jeep themed after a military video game.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team gives a 2012 Mustang GT a complete RTR package.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team fixes a vibration in a BMW 3 series and the AC in a 4Runner.

programme.title: Episode 7
programme.desc: Who is the real ‘Loose Cannon’? Lily Newhouse is the amateur who qualified to play in this high stakes cash game. But it’s Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky who’s confusing pros like Sam Grafton with his unpredictable playing style.

programme.title: Episode 8
programme.desc: More high stakes action from Las Vegas. ‘Loose Cannon’ Lily Newhouse switches up her style, while local entrepreneur Dave Krosky sticks to his maverick methods. But have the pros finally started to figure him out?

programme.title: Episode 9
programme.desc: The penultimate session of this high stakes cash games sees Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky test the patience of his opponents. Meanwhile, pro players Maria Ho and Sam Grafton clash in a huge pot.

programme.title: Episode 10
programme.desc: The pressure is on, as this high stakes Vegas poker game concludes. Loose Cannon Lily only has a few hands left to make a profit. Can she find a spot? Meanwhile, Dave is playing wilder than ever.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Todd Helton became the first batter to hit for the cycle while leading off an inning in every at-bat. It started with a double in the 2nd and ended with a triple in the 7th, bringing Coors Field to its feet.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Mike Trout becomes the youngest player to ever hit a cycle in a 12-0 win over the Marlins.

programme.title: Great Games

programme.title: Epic Moments

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: Thought to be unavailable to pitch in Game 5 of the 1999 ALDS against Cleveland because of an injury suffered earlier in the series, Pedro Martinez instead authored one of the single most inspiring performances in postseason history.

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: In one of the greatest single-game World Series performances of all-time, Pablo Sandoval gets the Giants off and running with a three-homer game in Game 1 against the Tigers.

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: My Oh My! Relive the story of the 1995 Seattle Mariners, a team led by Ken Griffey Jr, Randy Johnson and Edgar Martinez. Thrilling postseason moments, interviews from former players and more highlight this in-depth look at an unforgettable season.

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: The Rockies struggled early in the 2007 season, but as September approached, the club went on a rampage. Colorado would win 13 of 14 games to end the regular season and force a one-game playoff against the Padres.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Felix Hernandez was flawless against the Rays to throw the first perfect game in Mariners history.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 8/12/21 - In the inaugural MLB Field of Dreams Game, Tim Anderson belts a dramatic walk-off home run in the 9th inning, leading the White Sox to a 9-8 win over the Yankees.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/18/12: Max Scherzer struck out 10 batters and Miguel Cabrera homered to lead the Tigers in Game 4 of the ALCS, completing a four-game sweep of the Yankees.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/01/07: After winning 13 of their last 14 games, the Rockies forced a Game 163 against the Padres with the NL Wild Card on the line. It would take 13 innings, but Colorado's historic run would continue thanks to a walk-off sacrifice fly.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Dodgers' ace Clayton Kershaw strikes out 15 Rockies in a near-perfect no-hitter.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 5/20/06: Giants slugger Barry Bonds crushes his 714th career home run, tying Babe Ruth on the all-time list.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Mark McGwire crushes his 69th and 70th home runs on the final day of the season for the Cardinals.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series Film from 1980 highlights the Phillies capturing their first win in their 98-year span.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1981 matchup between the Dodgers and the Yankees. New York took a 2-0 series lead, but Los Angeles battled back behind strong pitching and a deep lineup to secure the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1986 matchup between the Mets and the Red Sox. A famous error in the 10th inning of Game 6 from Boston's Bill Buckner helped New York rally from a 3-2 series deficit and take home the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first World Series to be played in an indoor ballpark, the Twins used their familiarity with the Metrodome to their advantage to capture their first World Series Championship since moving to Minnesota.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Energized by an unthinkable pinch-hit walk-off homer from Kirk Gibson, the Los Angeles Dodgers rally to upset the Oakland Athletics in five games to win the 1988 World Series.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1991 matchup between the Twins and the Braves. Both teams went from worst to first before battling it out in a close series that showcased five games decided by one run and the Twins securing the World Series title.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: For years the Braves ruled the NL like no team since the Dodgers of the 1950s. And like Brooklyn, Atlanta found itself turned away time and again in October. With the additions of youth and spunk, it was time for the Team of the 90s to get their Title.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1996 matchup between the Yankees and the Braves. Rookie of the Year Derek Jeter led New York from a 2-0 deficit to win four straight and bring the World Series back to the Bronx for the first time in almost 20 years.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1997 matchup between the Marlins and the Indians. A back and forth series between Florida and Cleveland, the Marlins walked it off in the 11th inning of Game 7 to give the team its first World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Having set a modern-day record for most wins in the regular season, the Yankees faced the Padres and established themselves as one of the best teams to ever put on the Pinstripes.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series MVP Mariano Rivera leads the Yankees to the franchise's third championship in the last four seasons and 25th overall, sweeping the Braves in four games in a rematch of the 1996 Fall Classic.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 1A of the 2004 WSOP Main Event is underway with Daniel Negreanu, Men "The Master" Nguyen, and John Hennigan on the feature table. Defending champion Chris Moneymaker kicks off his title defense, while several big names find themselves heading home early.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Coverage continues on Day 1B of the WSOP Main Event, and last year's runner-up Sammy Farha headlines the feature table along with John Juanda. Chris Ferguson and "Miami" John Cernuto then join the feature table action, as many poker pros hit the rail on Day 1B.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 2 action in the WSOP Main Event sees Doyle Brunson headline the feature table along with Scott Fischman. Siblings Howard Lederer and Annie Duke are eliminated, along with two previous Main Event champions.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Money day has arrived in the WSOP Main Event with just 277 players remaining on Day 3. Gus Hansen takes center stage on the feature table, and is joined by Daniel Alaei and Dan Harrington while two other previous champions also survive the day.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 149 players remain in the 2004 WSOP Main Event, and Mike Matusow headlines the feature table alongside Greg "Fossilman" Raymer and John Esposito. However, it would be John Murphy, Josh Arieh, and Marcel Luske climbing to the top of the leaderboard.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: World Champions Dan Harrington and Chris Ferguson headline the feature table on Day 5 of the WSOP Main Event. The only other former champion wouldn't survive, as Doyle Brunson was eliminated.

programme.desc: The final night of Holidays with Hellmuth brought out a festive lineup and some great poker action! Poker legends Phil Hellmuth Daniel Negreanu and Doyle Brunson were joined by Maria Ho and first-timers Dave Penski and Joe Marchese with $150000 at st

programme.desc: The Event #1: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Jeremy Ausmus is the chip leader ahead of Erik Seidel, Jacky Wang, Nick Schulman, Cole Ferraro, Anthony Hu, and Cary Katz, as the final seven players play for the $204,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #2: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Michael Brinkenhoff is the chip leader ahead of Ethan Yau, Alex Foxen, Stephen Song, Masashi Oya, and Dylan DeStefano, as the final six players play for the $197,600 first-place prize.

programme.title: It Ain’t Easy
programme.desc: Mack is the son of a prostitute, and has picked up the trade of becoming a pimp, until he decides to seek revenge on his enemy, Memphis Slim.

programme.title: Entanglement
programme.desc: In Atlanta, a down-on-his-luck radio DJ gets his heart broken on the air, then as his career rises, meets a caller whom he once gave romantic advice.

programme.title: Animal
programme.desc: In this crime-drama starring football superstar Jim Brown, a notorious gangster must reconcile his past in order to make a future for his criminally-minded son.

programme.title: Thanksgiving With the Carters: 2nd Helping
programme.desc: The Carter Family is back to celebrate a positive and traditional Thanksgiving at a wooded cabin, but chaos and a ruined dinner have to be fixed.

programme.title: Complexions
programme.desc: An aspiring actress feels the heavy costs of having dark skin in an industry and world which places aesthetic value on lighter-skinned women.

programme.title: Imprisoned by Love
programme.desc: Below the surface of her perfect life, Tracie weathers constant marital abuse for the sake of her children. What will it cost to save herself?

programme.title: All for the Money
programme.desc: A 67-year-old man who still lives with his mother falls in love with a woman half his age.

programme.title: To Dance With Olivia
programme.desc: A Black Southern lawyer’s case in defense of a farmer charged with shooting a white congressman's son unearths the truth about his own child’s death.

programme.title: The Long Walk Home
programme.desc: Set in 1955 Montgomery, Alabama, this is the story of two women who must decide how they will respond to Martin Luther King Jr.’s call to boycott.

programme.title: Sideline Confessions
programme.desc: Marketing executive Candy Boudreaux tackles her biggest campaign when she decides to pursue football star Eric Whitaker, but egotistical Eric has no plans to settle down with just one woman. Candy consults with Eric's family, friends and associates to learn how she can make him fall in love with her.

programme.title: Clover
programme.desc: When her father dies shortly after his remarriage, a young African American girl struggles to cope while left in the care of her new, white stepmom.

programme.title: Subspiral
programme.desc: A young man who has worked to take a different path from his wayward brother falls for a woman who forces him into the life he’d hoped to avoid.

programme.title: Hav Faith
programme.desc: A man is elevated to lead a prominent church where issues arise between him, the son of the retiring bishop and a money-hungry real estate broker.

programme.title: Book of Songs
programme.desc: A down on his luck musician is antagonistic to the churchgoers next door until he is introduced to the bible through music, leading to an epiphany.

programme.title: Deceitful Storm
programme.desc: A wife makes the shocking discovery that her husband is cheating on her. God can forgive him, but is he willing to atone for his sins?

programme.title: Thanksgiving With the Carters: 2nd Helping
programme.desc: The Carter Family is back to celebrate a positive and traditional Thanksgiving at a wooded cabin, but chaos and a ruined dinner have to be fixed.

programme.title: For the Love of Christmas
programme.desc: Rashad Williams faces down the pressures of making a dramatic career choice and getting married to Lauren—and all before Christmas Day.

programme.title: It Ain’t Easy
programme.desc: Mack is the son of a prostitute, and has picked up the trade of becoming a pimp, until he decides to seek revenge on his enemy, Memphis Slim.

programme.title: Single Bells
programme.desc: When the Bell sisters lose their family restaurant during Christmas, they hatch a plan to save it—and unexpectedly find romance along the way.

programme.title: The Christmas Spirit
programme.desc: This Christmas, Faith is forced to choose between taking over her recently deceased father's church or handing it over to a new minister.

programme.title: Our Dream Christmas
programme.desc: Gabby and her family spend one last Christmas in LA with her dying mom, where secrets are revealed that could threaten their tranquility.

programme.title: Coming Home For Christmas
programme.desc: Coming from mixed backgrounds, adopted siblings Smythe, Hanna, Bea, Shane and Lonny, along with parents Pat and Samantha, will have to search for a higher spirit to get them through the holiday season.

Promising to carry the woman's newborn to safety, the repentant criminals struggle to reach the village of New Jerusalem.

programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is in Tiverton in Devon and The Angel Guest House where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience, but will they prove too competitive for the guests?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is The Compton Swan in Newbury, owned by Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan. Expectations are high after Joan reveals she was named Ireland's Business Woman of the Year.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Starting in Betws-y-coed, North Wales, where at Llwyn Onn Guest House, bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn hope their no-nonsense attitude will win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton on Tees, where newlywed managers Jon and Chelli Bean are all about making things perfect for pooches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Great Glen in Leicestershire and The Pug and Greyhound, where Nicola Ellershaw and her colleague, Mackenzie Griffey, hope their super-stylish accommodation will dazzle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant run by mother and son team Fiona and James Milligan who opened their doors eight months ago after a million pound refurbishment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Troy House in Painswick, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope their guests will fall in love with their rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Flying the flag on day two are Norfolk couple Jenny and Richard Harmer, from Chimneys B&B in North Walsham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to The George and Abbotsford in Melrose, Scotland, where host Andrea Gardner and front of house manager John Marr pull out all the stops.

programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Malvern, Worcestershire where retired pro-rugby player Steve Lloyd and partner Kathy Leather open their Copper Beech House to fellow B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: The final visit is to the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, owned by Mark and Lowrie Price. All guests are charmed by the medieval inn, but there's still underlying tension.

programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Delamere Farm in Northborough, where owner Agi Chapman, who is joined by Jayne Thorpe Godman, prides herself on providing a luxurious sleep to all her visitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Harrogate where management team Chris `Clarky' Clarke and Katie Light help run the White Hart Hotel. The guests meet some llamas and the extra charge for fancy coffee causes a stir.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to New Promenade Hotel in Blackpool, owned by Raouf, who is joined by friend Chrissie. There's a teetering toilet seat and Clarky and Katie find muck on the taps.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Vicky's small terraced house, aptly named The Terrace, in Oxford. On inspection, two pairs of guests discover an array of filthy finds, including a pre-sucked sweet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Robin and Liza's Georgian mansion Tall John's House in the Brecon Beacons. At dinner the guests gush over their new friendships but Vicky doesn't share their feelings.

programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit sees Sam and Henry confident that their five-star rooms above a quintessential English country pub, The Bear and Swan, in Chew Magna, Somerset, will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Guesthouse East in Eastbourne, where childhood sweethearts Tony and Lisa hope their guests will fall head over heels for their family friendly B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Shirley B&B in Bournemouth, where Jorge Mesquita hopes to impress his guests with his all-round cleanliness and the power of his showers.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Marlow Lodge in Blackpool, where owner Deano Whiting prides himself on delivering the fun factor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host this week is manager James Hall and owner's son Adam Neale of The Black Swan in Horsham St Faith, a luxury roomed establishment with onsite restaurant and pub.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Bleak House in Broadstairs, where sisters Nina and Nicola Hilton have `Great Expectations' of success and the guests are blown away by a Dickens discovery.

programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Springfield House in Instow, Devon, where Lucinda Renshaw, who is joined in the competition by friend Diane Passmore, transformed this home in to a B&B eight years ago.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S02:E09 - Episode 9

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E02 - The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
In tonight's final programme Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater in Brighton where he oversaw one of the most spectacular changes of fortune at a single venue. Owner CHARITA JONES was producing a menu of irresistible unique classics from the Deep South, but at the same facing financial disaster. The punters were missing, and so was her business acumen. But Gordon succeeded in shutting her out of the kitchen, getting the chef back on the boil and putting the soul back into the business.
Today Charita is fully-booked round the clock and bursting out of the Soul Shack to take on the 110-seater Momma Cherri's Big House. But expansion brings a different set of challenges, and she's still struggling to control her staff and manage her success. Has she got what it takes to make the next step up, or will she be forced to rethink her grand plans?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's penultimate programme Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasted top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff, all of them on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of the haggis. But the locals weren't biting and the restaurant was empty most nights. Gordon's recipe for survival forced them to tone down their act and demystify the menu to get the punters in. Today the restaurant's return to form has led to plans for expansion. Loic is still there, and now he's been promoted to Executive Chef he will oversee any new ventures. But can he continue to resist a return to French frills, and has he managed to pull off his own personal ambition, a Michelin star?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Phil Howard, Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness cook their main courses, but only one chef will take gold. Will it be Phil with roast loin of lamb with pie and mash, carrots, nettles and mint; Graham with slow cooked marsh lamb breast, rasher and spiced rissole; or Marcus with blade of beef cooked in hay, tendons and beetroot?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Phil Howard, Graham Garrett and Marcus McGuinness present their dessert dishes here. Will it be Phil with rhubarb and custard souffle, Marcus with asparagus, goat's curd and black olive, or Graham with lemon meringue? Veteran Jason Atherton decides who goes through to the judges and who is going home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from the London and South East region. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. The chef's task is to create a menu which captures the Olympic spirit.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the Wales chefs: returning contenders Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry. All are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. Stephen Terry cooks `The Opening Ceremony', Richard Davies makes ravioli of quail, parfait of foie gras, roasted salsify and Madeira jelly, and James Sommerin cooks sage cream, onion, chicken and Welsh `Brie' truffle toast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry are all determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. They cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be Stephen Terry with `The Fish and Shellfish Medley', Richard Davies with compression of vine tomato, poached lobster and hand dived scallop, or James Sommerin with lobster and Iberico ham, spiced butter and broccoli?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their main course, but only one chef will take gold. Will it be Stephen Terry with `The Bunny Pentathlon', Richard Davies with slow cooked rib of beef, beetroot ketchup, bone marrow and braised shallot, or James Sommerin with mangalitsa pork, carrot, liquorice and leek?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their dessert, but who will impress? Stephen Terry with `Bronze, Silver or Gold?', Richard Davies with passion fruit cream and gel with bitter chocolate sorbet or James Sommerin with raspberry and lemon cheesecake? `Great British Menu' veteran Angela Hartnett decides who goes through to the judges on Friday and who is going home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Wales. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: South West contenders Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw, plus newcomer Simon Hulstone, kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Paul with his `Breakfast of Champions'; Nathan with hogs pudding with seaweed, potato terrine and mushroom ketchup; or Simon Hulstone with track and field - beetroot and goats cheese?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish course, but which one but which one will prevail? Will it be Paul Ainsworth with monkfish `Two Showings'; Nathan Outlaw with mackerel, horseradish and oyster sauce; or Simon Hulstone with `The Swimming Pool'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' final chance to impress the veteran with their dessert dishes. Will it be Paul Ainsworth with `Then and Now'; Nathan Outlaw with elderflower and lemon tart, with strawberry sorbet and meringues; or Simon Hulstone with `Closing Ceremony'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time on Great British Menu for the chefs from the South West region. One chef left the competition on the previous day and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The 2012 competition enters its final week. The winners of the regional heats compete for a chance for their dish to be on the final banquet menu at a prestigious event hosted by Sir Steve Redgrave with a glittering guest list of British Olympians. Here, the finalists cook their starters, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight winners of the regional heats prepare to cook their fish dishes, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Marcus Wareing. Before they get into the kitchen, they must first learn whether they will all be cooking.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: On day three, the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's desserts day in the finals, and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. After a hard-fought week, the end of this programme will see the judges finally reveal the winning four dishes which will make up this year's `Great British Menu'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This final programme follows the successful chefs in the run-up to the Olympic banquet at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, as they make the painstaking preparations for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook. The four winning chefs prepare an outstanding four-course menu for a truly Olympian guest list.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs are all fighting for supremacy in the fish course. So who is going to come out on top? Will it be lobster cocktail cooked four ways, lobster with vegetables, or mussels and langoustine with sorrel soup and tattie scones?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the main courses, as the Scottish chefs go all out to win, with their takes on hogget Scotch pie with peas and carrots, steak and chips with a tomato relish and lamb with haggis, pearl barley and turnip puree.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Scottish chefs Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison to show they've got what it takes to win. So which dessert will deliver the sweet smell of success - strawberry shortbread with whisky cream, carrot cake with cream cheese ice-cream or rhubarb and custard with ginger biscuits? And which chef will be going home early?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judgement day and the two chefs must cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: rabbit with pea mousse, ham hock with pea puree and heather smoked macon with pickled beetroot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from the South West - Henry Herbert, John Hooker and Nathan Outlaw - are all out to impress with their fish dishes: cider-cured sea trout, poached lobster with courgette flowers and trout, crayfish and pike mousse.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Odion tries to get the good Marik to resist his evil half. As a result, Yami Marik becomes angered, and attacks Odion with the Millennium Rod, which weakens Odion even more. Odion doesn't give up, despite Ishizu's protests. As Marik continues his onslaught (which begins to injure Odion), Odion tells Marik's good side that together, they had conquered his evil half before, and that they could do it again. Then, he tells the good Marik that since Yami Marik was created by the good Marik's hatred, he has the power to destroy him. As Yami Marik raises the Rod to deliver the final blow, the good Marik disappears from the field, and begins fighting against Yami Marik, who struggles for control over Marik's body, and refuses to be defeated. However, Marik's good half stalls Yami Marik long enough for Yugi to activate his spell card. Yugi's Ragnarok spell succeeds in destroying (and removing to the graveyard) Ra, allowing the good Marik to regain control of his body. However, a sliver of Yami Marik reappears on the field, although this time, he is the victim. Yami Marik tries to convince the good Marik to help him seize the Millennium Items and rule the world together, but fails as Marik has decided to stop being evil and make up for his actions. Marik surrenders the duel to Yugi, which sends Yami Marik to the Shadow Realm, ending the Battle City finals. Bakura and Mai are returned from the shadow realm and Marik is reunited with his siblings, who forgive him. Yugi receives the three Egyptian God Cards. Kaiba then activates the Duel Tower's self-destruct sequence, giving everybody one hour to get off the island before it explodes.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
